result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell W Sankey

defendant.name: Sankey, Mitchell W
defendant.address: 13866 West Honey Lane, New Berlin, WI 53151

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mitchell W Sankey not in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Mitchell W Sankey.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Statements by defense regarding defendant's non-appearance. Court waives defendant's appearance for today's proceedings. Defense requests another plea/sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
& Addendum, State's Offer Letter, and Elements of the Offense, filed.

Defendant Mitchell W Sankey in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and setencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Mitchell W Sankey in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 061643,
Payable Number: 1017702,
Receipt Number: 22RP027141,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 07/21/2022@2p
